message: http://www.tuaw.com/2011/03/29/rumor-blackberry-messenger-to-land-in-the-app-store-on-april-26/ just read this and i am pumped i hope this happens i love BBM and there are other ones that come close but none of them have all the features of BBM plus the userbase alone is worth this
http://www.blogcdn.com//media/2011/03/ios-bbm-crop-32911.jpg
interesting,.. would love it if they just open up API (so I can use it on meebo), and dump all that PIN crap out the window
I'm curious what do BBM users see in BBM? in 3 short years the IM apps on the iOS platform in some respects are more powerful if not adequet
I had no idea bbm was even in ios
@laurentlogan I like how you can have these groups and share photos and see if a message was read or not just little things to spice up texting
@unwrangle i doubt it too much security involved
I use IM+ and am very happy witbit.
@MarkLaViolette that picture is a photoshopped version but April 26 it maybe a reality
I used a BB for a year. I would say the ability to know when a user has read your message is good to know.  Also it has a large base already built-up sure helps.
It is seems to send messages fast also.

http://www.bgr.com/2011/03/30/rim-is-not-releasing-blackberry-messenger-for-iphone-on-april-26th/ i guess this not happening, crushed dreams, i shouldn't be crushed i am a google voice user so i am used to use it
meh, at this point we don't really need it anyways,.. there's WhatsApp for BB, I guessed having BBM on iphone doesn't have any impact on anyone but WhatsApp
My problem with whatsapp is that you have to give out your phone number. I love the app but hate giving out a phone number to people I don't know so well.
What does Whatsapp do
then you contact them via twitter or something. I won't give BBM pin to anyone that I wouldn't mind sharing my phone number as well...
http://www.whatsapp.com/

like SMS/MMS for mobile devices via the web, although no web UI because every it assigned to your phone number,.. so it uses your contacts to populate 'friend' list. and available on all smartphone platform.
I use WhatsApp all the time. It's awesome.
Can U use it on an iPad1
